ramseeker is sponsored by

OEMPCWORLD MemoryX

Aug 23, 2016

MacBook Pro 13 2.8GHz dual-core Intel Core i7


The MacBook Pro 13 2.8GHz dual-core Intel Core i7 requires the use of ddr3 1600Mhz so-dimms in either 8 or 16GB configurations. The Maximum ram you can buy for this specific MacBook pro is 16GB.

The possible memory upgrade configurations are:

8GB (4GB X 2)

16GB (8GB x 2)

The MacBook Pro 13” 2.8GHz dual-core Intel Core i7 has 2 memory upgrade slots available for use. You will need to replace the factory installed memory if you wish to upgrade the ram.

The pulled ram can then be sold or traded in to further offset the cost of your upgrade.

Compatible Brands of MacBook Pro RAM for the MacBook Pro 13:

Crucial

OWC

Corsair

MemoryX

OEMPCWORLD

Aug 22, 2016

MacBook Pro 15 2.2GHz quad-core Intel Core i7


The MacBook Pro 15” 2.2GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 can accept up to 16GB of RAM via the 2 memory upgrade slots available on this Apple notebook computer.

If you prefer you can upgrade to half the memory to just 8GB, but with RAM so cheap these days and considering how much you paid for your Macbook Pro you might as well max out the ram to 16GB

When shopping for memory for the 15 inch 2.2Ghz i7 Macbook Pro be sure to buy ddr3 1600Mhz sodimms.

Brands that I recommend for this particular MacBook Pro are available from:

Crucial

OWC

Corsair

MemoryX

OEMPCWORLD

This is Good Schiit


This has to be the best company name. Ever.

These folks make high end audio gear specializing in USB DACs and Headphone Amplifiers. I’ve had the magni/modi usb dac and headphone amp combo in the past and it sounded awesome.

They now have ‘version 2’ of this rig and for under $200 this is a steal if you’re serious about your headphone listening.

Remember this? I do.

For longtime Mac users, this should remind us of the MHz Wars when BYTE magazine showed the 233 MHz Power Mac G3 easily outperformed the 333 MHz Pentium II using its cross-platform BYTEmark benchmark test.

Aug 10, 2016

MacBook Pro 15 2.3GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 Memory Upgrades


The MacBook Pro 15” 2.3GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 can accept up to 16GB of RAM via the two memory upgrade slots available on this Apple notebook computer.

You can also install 8GB of RAM if you so choose, but I recommend maxing out this MacBook Pro model to the maximum amount and the price difference between 8GB of RAM and 16GB of RAM for this MacBook Pro is only about $25.00 for twice as much ram

The MacBook Pro 15” 2.3GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 requires the use of DDR3 1600Mhz sodimms.

Aug 08, 2016

MacBook Pro 15 2.7GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 Memory Upgrades


The Apple MacBook Pro 15” 2.7GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 can be upgraded with a maximum of 16gb of RAM with the two memory slots available. And if 16GB is too much ram then you can install just 8GB of ram as well.

The following memory configurations for this specific Apple notebook computer are:

16GB MacBook Pro RAM (8gb x 2)

8GB MacBook Pro RAM (4gb x 2)

The MacBook Pro 15” 2.7GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 requires the purchase of DDR3 1600Mhz so-dimms.

Aug 08, 2016

MacBook Pro 15 2.6GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 Memory Upgrades


The MacBook Pro 15 2.6GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 can accept up to 16GB of memory with the 2 memory upgrade slots available

There are 2 memory upgrade options:

8GB ram upgrade (4GB X 2)

16GB ram upgrde (8GB x 2)

This specific model of MacBook Pro requires the use of DDR3 1600 Mhz sodimms.

Aug 05, 2016

MacBook Pro 15" 2.3GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 Memory Upgrades


The Apple MacBook Pro 15” 2.3GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 can accept up to 16GB of memory by upgrading the ram in the 2 memory slots

Available Memory Upgrade Configurations

8GB (4gb x 2)

16GB (8GB x2)

This particular MacBook Pro model requires the use of DDR3 1600MHz so-dimms.

Aug 05, 2016

Lenovo ThinkPad X220 Memory


The Lenovo Thinkpad X220 can accept up to 8GB of RAM by filling the two slots with 8GB Memory Upgrade Kits

Memory Type Needed: DDR3L-1600 SODIMM

Memory Configurations: 2x2GB = 4GB Kits or 2x4GB = 8GB Kits
